concise_definition: v. 抢夺, 抓取, 突然取得; n. 一抓, 瞬间

definitions.explanation_en: To take something quickly and suddenly, often by force or in a secretive manner, usually without permission.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指迅速而突然地夺取某物，通常带有暴力或秘密性质，且未经允许。
definitions.example_en: The thief snatched her purse and ran down the alley.
definitions.example_cn: 小偷抢走她的包，跑进了小巷。

definitions.explanation_en: To catch or grab something briefly or hastily, often in mid-air or while it is moving.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指匆忙或短暂地抓住某物，通常是在其运动过程中。
definitions.example_en: She snatched the falling book just before it hit the floor.
definitions.example_cn: 她在书掉到地上前的一刻抓住了它。

definitions.explanation_en: To obtain something briefly or with great effort, especially under time pressure or limited opportunity.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在时间紧迫或机会有限的情况下，勉强获得某物。
definitions.example_en: He managed to snatch a few hours of sleep before the meeting.
definitions.example_cn: 他在会议前勉强挤出几个小时睡觉。

definitions.explanation_en: A brief, sudden act of grabbing or taking something; a quick capture or seizure.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一次短暂而突然的抓取或夺取行为；一次迅速的劫持或捕获。
definitions.example_en: It was only a snatch of conversation, but it was enough to raise suspicion.
definitions.example_cn: 那只是几句断断续续的对话，但已足以引起怀疑。

definitions.explanation_en: A short period of time, especially one that is unexpectedly available or used.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一段短暂的时间，尤指意外获得或被利用的片刻。
definitions.example_en: I stole a snatch of lunch between meetings.
definitions.example_cn: 我在会议间隙偷空吃了点午饭。

comparison.analysis: “Steal” (偷窃) 强调非法占有他人财物的持续性行为，通常带有隐蔽性和预谋性，不强调动作的突然性。而 “snatch” 更突出动作的迅猛、瞬间和暴力性，常发生在公开场合，且可能伴随身体接触。
“Grab” (抓取) 是一个更中性、更通用的词，指用手快速抓住某物，不一定有恶意或暴力成分。而 “snatch” 常带有掠夺、强行夺取的负面含义，隐含剥夺他人所有物的意图。
“Seize” (夺取) 通常用于正式或法律语境，指通过权威或力量强行控制某物，常用于政府、军队或执法行为。它比 “snatch” 更庄重、更持久，而 “snatch” 更口语化、更短暂且更具突发性。
